conbody.p: In this example, the cloud architect determined that if the Cloud Controllers, Walrus hosts, and the Cluster Controllers could reach company routers 1 and 2, then cloud users should be able to reach back to the cloud services. Because users could be connecting from multiple networks to different network interfaces on the Eucalyptus hosts, it is recommended to configure a separate arbitrator to test network reachability through each NIC to each network where users might be. Only three arbitrators may be configured on a Cluster Controller, but more arbitrators can be configured on Cloud Controllers and Walrus hosts.
Failover from one host to another not only occurs if its Eucalyptus service fails, but also if all the arbitrators on the host fail to connect to their external IP addresses.
